Detailed Description

Interface for the Octeon CSR database.

Revision
127322

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_FIELD
Enumerator:
CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_RSL 

Octeon internal address, but indirect and slow (not used for addresses).

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_NCB 

Octeon internal address.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCI_NCB 

Can be accessed through PCI BAR0, also an NCB alias (not used for addresses).

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCICONFIG 

PCI Config, also an NCB alias.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCI 

PCI BAR0 (only).

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PEXP 

PCIe BAR 0 address only.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PEXP_NCB 

NCB-direct and PCIe BAR0 address.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PEXPV_NCB 

NCB-direct and PCIe BAR0 address for O3.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCICONFIGEP 

PCIe config address (EP mode) + indirect through PESC*_CFG_RD/PESC*_CFG_WR.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_PCICONFIGRC 

PCICONFIGRC - PCIe config address (RC mode) + indirect through PESC*_CFG_RD/PESC*_CFG_WR.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_SRIOMAINT 

SRIOMAINT - SRIO maintenance registers.

CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE_BPHY_RSL 

BPHY - Baseband PHY registers.

Function Documentation

void cvmx_csr_db_decode ( int  identifier,
uint64_t  address,
uint64_t  value 
)

Decode a CSR value into named bitfields.

The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.

Parameters:
identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
address CSR address being decoded
value Value to decode
void cvmx_csr_db_decode_by_name ( int  identifier,

)

Decode a CSR value into named bitfields.

The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.

csr_name CSR name to decode
value Value to decode

Decode a CSR value into named bitfields.

The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.

csr_name CSR name to decode

const CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE* cvmx_csr_db_get ( int  identifier,
const char *  name 
)

Get the CSR DB entry for the passed Octeon model and CSR name.

The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.

Parameters:
identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
name CSR name to lookup
Returns:
CSR DB entry or NULL on failure
int cvmx_csr_db_get_params ( int  identifier,
char *  csr_name,
uint64_t *  paddr,
int *  ptype,
char **  pbasename,
int *  pwidth 
)

Given DB identifer and csr_name, find out the CSR's address, type, basename and CSR width.

Returns:
0 for success, -1 if the csr_name doesn't match anything in the database, and -2 if the match is found but an index is out of range.

Note: the function uses binary search over the database. This requires that the database entries are in assending order wrt the CSR basename.

int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_basename ( int  identifier,
char *  basename,
char *  pattern,
int  decode 
)

Print CSR given in the form "lmc(0..0)_char_mask(0..4)".

This means that this func will pring all the CSRs with names that end on 0 to 4. The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.

Parameters:
identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
basename CSR name as is in CSR DB
pattern The pattern that user searches for
decode If == 0 - print the entry; else decode it.
Returns:
0 on success, <0 on error
int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_basename_node ( int  node,
int  identifier,
char *  basename,
char *  pattern,
int  decode 
)

Print CSR given in the form "lmc(0..0)_char_mask(0..4)".

This means that this func will pring all the CSRs with names that end on 0 to 4. The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id.

Parameters:
node node number
identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
basename CSR name as is in CSR DB
pattern The pattern that user searches for
decode If == 0 - print the entry; else decode it.
Returns:
0 on success, <0 on error
int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_prefix ( int  identifier,
const char *  prefix,
int  decode 
)

Print or decode all csrs names beginning with a prefix.

The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id. For decoding it must not be remote.

Parameters:
identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
prefix Beginning prefix to look for
decode If == 0 - print the entry; else decode it.
int cvmx_csr_db_print_decode_by_prefix_node ( int  node,
int  identifier,
const char *  prefix,
int  decode 
)

Print or decode all csrs names beginning with a prefix.

The model can either be specified as a processor id or PCI id. For decoding it must not be remote.

Parameters:
node node number
identifier Identifer to choose the CSR DB with
prefix Beginning prefix to look for
decode If == 0 - print the entry; else decode it.
void cvmx_csr_db_reg_dump ( char *  csr_name  ) 

Given the CSR name, print the decoded values of the node-local register(s).

CSR name format = CSR name as provided in HRM doc, with index ranges or specific index numbers. Example 1: "PKI_CL(0..3)_SMEM(0..2047)" Example 2: "PKI_CL1_SMEM16"

Parameters:
csr_name CSR name
void cvmx_csr_db_reg_dump_node ( int  node,
char *  csr_name 
)
uint64_t cvmx_csr_db_rsvd_mask ( int  identifier,
char *  csr_defname 
)

Return an uint64_t for a csr where the bits for all the reserved fields are set to 1.

Parameters:
identifier is the processor ID or a PCI ID.
csr_defname is the macro name of a CSR, as defined in the cvmx-xxxx-defs.h.
Returns:
(uint64_t)-1 for error.
int cvmx_db_get_chipindex ( int  identifier  ) 

Figure out which database to use for this chip.

The passed identifier can be a processor ID or a PCI ID.

Parameters:
identifier processor ID or a PCI ID
Returns:
index into the csr db

Variable Documentation

const uint64_t __csrdb_addrinc[][4]

Internal 2-dim array to hold the increment values for CSR addresses.

const __CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE* __cvmx_csr_db[]

This NULL terminated array contains the CVMX_CSR_DB_TYPE arrays for each chip.

Each array entry is another NULL terminated array of CSRs.

const int __cvmx_csr_db_cnt[]

This 0 terminated array contains the count of the entries in the per chip arrays.

This is used to skip counting the members of the CSR arrays.

const __CVMX_CSR_DB_FIELD_TYPE* __cvmx_csr_db_fields[]

This NULL terminated array contains the CVMX_CSR_DB_FIELD_TYPE arrays for each chip.

Each array entry is another NULL terminated array of CSR fields.

const CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE* cvmx_csr_db_addresses[]

This NULL terminated array contains the CVMX_CSR_DB_ADDRESS_TYPE arrays for each chip.

Each array entry is another NULL terminated array of CSR addresses.
